info.name: Locus coeruleus
info.description: The locus coeruleus (AKA locus ceruleus) is a noradrenergic nucleus located in the floor of the fourth ventricle at the level of the rostral pons. It is dark blue-black in appearance on unstained tissue due to the presence of pigment (probably melanin) in the cells.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/12 Brain stem - parasagittal view
